item.title: A “Stumbling” US Encryption Policy
item.description: Authors: Madsen, Wayne Published: July 1997 URL: http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1361372397895486 Tags: 1990s Clinton Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I Export Controls Key Recovery Abstract: “Are those in opposition to the administration’s [encryption] policy prepared to sacrifice public safety in the interests of commercial gain?” Those words, uttered by Deputy Assistant Attorney General Robert Litt, would etch themselves in the minds of those who attended the 7 May 1977 House International Economic Policy and Trade hearing on “Encryption: Individual Rights vs National Security”.

item.title: The Risks of Key Recovery, Key Escrow, and Trusted Third-Party Encryption
item.description: Authors: H. Abelson, R. Anderson, S. M. Bellovin, J. Benaloh, M. Blaze, W. Diffie, J. Gilmore, P. G. Neumann, R. L. Rivest, J. I. Schiller, B. Schneier Published: 1998 URL: https://www.schneier.com/academic/archives/1997/04/the_risks_of_key_rec.html Tags: 1990s Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I Key Escrow Key Recovery Abstract: A variety of “key recovery,” “key escrow,” and “trusted third-party” encryption requirements have been suggested in recent years by government agencies seeking to conduct covert surveillance within the changing environments brought about by new technologies.
